intro: Wahlenbergia linarioides var. arida, commonly known as the arid wahlenbergia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to low water conditions. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves that help conserve moisture. This variety is notable for its resilience in harsh environments and is often found in coastal and inland deserts.
